data.title: On This Day in History Henry Wadsworth Longfellow died in 1882 of peritonitis at Cambridge, Massachusetts, USA. He was 75 years old....
data.meta_description:
3 likes, 0 comments - classic_literature_wikia on March 24, 2024: "On This Day in History

Henry Wadsworth Longfellow died in 1882 of peritonitis at Cambridge, Massachusetts, USA. He was 75 years old. Longfellow was an American poet and educator who is one of America’s renowned poets, and one of the fireside poets from New England. Some of his famous poems include “Evangeline” and “Paul Revere’s Ride”. He was also the first American to completely translate Dante Alighieri’s “Divine Comedy” into English. 

Jules Verne died in 1905 from complications of a stroke and diabetes in Amiens, France. He was 77 years old. Verne was a French novelist, poet and playwright who is one of the greatest French writers, alongside Alexandre Dumas and Victor Hugo. He is mostly known for his epic adventure and science fiction novels, such as 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea, Around the World in 80 days and Journey to the Center of the Earth. 

#classicliterature #classicbooks #onthisdayinhistory #henrywadsworthlongfellow #americanliterature #julesverne #19thcenturyliterature #frenchliterature".
